data.title: Trendy
data.text: If being relevant consists of drinking bad tasting beer and eating weirdly flavored, but healthy tacos, this place fits the bill.  Sometimes it seems people will eat food they do not like arrive at some sort of sophistication.

data.title: Disappointed to say the least!
data.text: Another Saturday afternoon adventure down town JC - I pass by White Duck every day on my way to work.  Always thought it looked like a fun place. So my husband and I had just left the Farmer's Market and decided to check it out.  Big Mistake! The lady taking our order was not at all friendly ~ she failed to tell us to get our glasses for our ice tea and failed to tell us it was a serve yourself with the tea and soft drinks.  We ordered Thai Chicken tacos ~ let me just say that I would rather eat at Taco Bells as to ever have anymore of White Duck Tacos.  Enough said!

data.title: Awesome Tacos
data.text: Tried the White Duck for the first time yesterday and came back for a return trip the next day. Want to try all 16 of their unique tacos eventually  but my favorite so far is the lamb gyro! Also love their cheddar chipotle grits. Prices are very good as well.

data.title: A taco experience
data.text: If you enjoy being a little adventurous with tacos, this is one of the Tri-Cities best options. We have taken friends there, some enjoy, some don't. Pluses are the great fusions of flavors. Cons for some are the limitaions of only being able to order whats offered, and that seating inside is limited and outside seating is great but can be noisy. We go to White Duck for light meals when we want a little different taste experience.

data.title: unique twist on tacos
data.text: Great variety  duck, shrimp, Korean tacos and more are on the menu. Friendliest server I've had in a while. Price was reasonable and had a great pub next store where they brought my tacos to me.

data.title: Great Tacos next to Great Beer=GREAT ATMOSPHERE!!
data.text: My husband and I try to visit 2-3 times a month. Every time has been consistently great. The menu does change by adding and taking away different tacos which we like!!  Adds variety!  Fast service, nice people.  We order tacos at White Duck and then seat ourselves next door at YeeHaw.  They bring the tacos out and everything is great!!  Don't forget about the Chips and Salsa Trio!!! Yumm!!

data.title: Loved the tacos
data.text:
Went their when we went to Yee Haw Brewer. Mid range meal about five bucks a taco. But were delicious. Lots of college kids. Friendly crowd. Even saw a dog enjoying the premises.
Good place worth visiting.

data.title: Awesome!
data.text: This is an amazing restaurant. I have eaten at a few of there locations. The one in Johnson City did not let me down. The ingredients are fresh and the staff is so friendly.

data.title: Creative Delicious Tacos
data.text: This place offers fresh tacos with some great combinations. These tacos are very unique and highly recommended.

data.title: Tacos done right
data.text: Steak, pork, chicken or veggie, these folks do it right. Don't worry about what to pick to top your taco, just trust the White Duck Taco crew to deliver an outstanding tasting taco every time - pick two or three, perfect dinner finished with a Yee-Haw Dunkel!

data.title: date night
data.text: Pretty good, not allot of choices, but what they have is pretty good. I don't think my kids would like it.

data.title: Wonderful tacos in a cool atmosphere
data.text: This is a fun place to enjoy interesting ingredients in a taco.  Beauitful building where you can inside or outside.  Just next door and connected to the taco shop is Yee Haw brewery with locally brewed beer.  Fun arcade games and corn hole outside.

data.title: Unique and Flavorful
data.text: Came here for a late dinner and was not disappointed.  I ordered the Jerk Chicken Taco (spicy, enjoyed the relish) and the Thai Peanut Chicken.  Both had great flavor and no additional condiments were required.  I paired them with a Yee Haw Brewery Munich Dunkel which perfectly complimented the meal.  I definitely look forward to coming back and trying some the other tacos on the extensive menu.

data.title: Simple but grand!
data.text: I'm a sucker for good tacos and these are beyond good. They are packed full of flavor but yet with very simple ingredients. My husband and I got two tacos each and that was plenty of food if not more than we really needed. We ordered the pork belly with pickled watermelon rind, spicy buffalo chicken, fish taco, and jerk chicken. My favorite was the fish taco. It was packed with so much flavor. My husband really liked the pork belly taco. Definitely give this place a try if you're ever in Johnson City. It's nice that's it located to YeeHaw Brewing so you can enjoy tacos and beer together.

data.title: Really good food
data.text: Awesome food. Interesting menu so go out there! Very friendly counter service. Great for all ages. Parking can be an issue. Everyone loved it!

data.title: Tacos and beer
data.text: We love coming here. Great atmosphere, great food, and fantastic craft beer! Pork belly tacos are one of my favorite!

data.title: Great Food and Beer
data.text: The tacos were great and the beer from the adjoining Yee Haw Brewery were also very good. Great atmosphere and well worth the trip.

data.title: Different!
data.text: I had heard about the White Duck Taco place and visited it with my adult son for the first time today. There is a very eclectic menu offering with different kinds of tacos served in a surprisingly traditional way. The atmosphere is contemporary and the wait staff very friendly and helpful. The food was served promptly and was very good. I had the potato and mushroom taco which was a little bit on the spicy side  but still a good blend of flavors. The tacos are served on warmed corn tortillas with an extra corn tortilla underneath to catch the leftover filling which is a very traditional Mexican way of serving tacos. All in all it was a great experience. The only Improvement I would make is adding perhaps one or two more traditional types of tacos for those of us who love eating down below the Border. My son has decided it's his new favorite restaurant.

data.title: Woo hoo!!! White Duck nearer than Asheville!
data.text: We love going to White Duck, and are so glad they opened in JC! Right next door to Yee Haw Brewery, really can't get any better than this for a fun, hip place to meet up with friends or meet new ones. The food is so different, not your typical tacos. The price is definitely right, and the atmosphere is funky fun. Go, you'll be glad you did, and be daring enough to try all of the great tacos!

data.title: Brews and food
data.text: Great beer ,best bar staff . every one . The food goes well with the beer. Prices are great and if you stay till 8 there is live music also
